nodes.bodyText: Why this double wrapping? new ArrayList<>(list) should be enough
correct, it's an oversight.
I think it makes more sense to raise an exception if user tries to perturb a list but the value is not a list. Wdyt?
Now that we handle all the types I think it could make sense to throw an exception here (actually this should never happen). Wdyt?
protected
Now that we handle all the types I think it could make sense to throw an exception here (actually this should never happen). Wdyt?
It is not resolved yet :)
Type.LIST has been dropped and this changed to use Type.COMPOSITE, not sure why it doesn't show up here ...

Can you please add some tests with List of Structure and List of List?
Can you also improve this last assertion? For example you can verify that the internal object type is correct in addition

Can you please clarify the scope of this perturb method? As far as I can see it generates a list of random numbers and then it uses them as index to remove elements.
In other words if it generates all the index the result will be an empty list etc but the values are not changed.
I was expecting more a method that alter the values inside the list and not only the number of elements
agreed, I decided to drop the Type.LIST in favor of using Type.COMPOSITE.

Can you explain this block of code?
I don't understand why we will have a completely different content for the list based on the type: if it is a unit it will be a list of JsonNode, if it is a structure we will have a list of list of Feature while if it is a collection we will nest another list.
Is this expected?

after reviewing the code I think this can much better resolved by using Type.COMPOSITE because it automatically handles "deep" perturbation of the items of the list and doesn't require this typed handling of the items of the list (they all get handled as Features).
Can you please add a test with List of Structure and List of List?
I've added a test with a List of List of Structures.

Can you please add a test with List of Structure and List of List?
Please improve the assertions too to verify the content too
I've added a test with a List of List of Structures.

why linkedlist?
it's ok to put ArrayList since we know the List size in advance, but I doubt the scale of no. of items we expect to have in such collections would cause a noticeable difference in practice.
any alternative to the name objects that is too much generic?
what about deepFeatures ? :)
